title: Erigon falls out of sync for several minutes on eth mainnet
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
erigon version 2.42.0-stable-beb97784

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Windows 10 

Commit hash:  beb97784d43ece5acde365a74efe8763692ebdba

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
"D:\ethereum\erigon\build\bin\erigon" --datadir "D:/ethereum/data" --port=30307 --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.port=8242 --http.vhosts=* --authrpc.port=8552 --private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9292 --http --http.api "eth,erigon,ots,net" --ws --prune=hrtc --db.pagesize=16k --torrent.port 25532 --nat=any --torrent.download.rate=20mb

Concensus Layer: 

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):

Chain/Network: eth mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
sync correctly and not fall behind

#### Actual behaviour
falls behind sometimes by a few hundred blocks and then eventually catches up before falling behind again


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
start erigon with above flags and wait

we see the same issue today

this issue should be with the software, not any ports or hardware - JB guesses that when more upgrade to it, more of them will start falling behind, too
Added to the issue is that we were running v2.40.1-devel until 4h ago, seeing the same issues arise as decribed, same now on v2.42.0!

After upgraded from `v2022.09.03` to `v2.42.0` because of the Shapella hardfork, we started to experience a lot of node issues. It's either lingering in `14/15 TxLookup Prune` or `[5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies` same block over and over again, causing it not to process new blocks for 20minutes in a row.
Your infinite loop observation could be related to #7260.

I also updated to 2.42 a week ago, but the situation you mentioned did not occur.

Do you run your own Lighthouse?
Similar strange issues on 2 nodes using built in lightclient as beacon chain. Keep falling behind for a few minutes usually 5, sometimes longer and then catching up.
Seeing same on `2.43.0-devel` one node is syncing properly while other node is running into this issue.

Running your own CL-client will solve these issues, I think the team is aware of this.
We are running Prysm currently and no issues since then!

If you are interested in running prysm, and want to know how to sync up with erigon quickly, have a look at:

https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/7077#issuecomment-1500755418

Thanks @keithchew, we were already running prysm but it has been stopped for a while since we were using embedded client. Given we are seeing issues with embedded client, i started syncing prysm again.
